intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium acrothyrsum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the roots are fibrous and rhizomatous. Hieracium acrothyrsum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
